differential_diagnosis: tick-borne illnesses (e.g., Lyme disease, Rocky Mountain spotted fever)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient initially presented with symptoms consistent with Sweet's syndrome, characterized by papules and plaques, along with fever and arthralgias. However, upon further investigation including a skin biopsy and thorough infectious workup, a diagnosis of disseminated tuberculosis was confirmed when lymph node biopsy revealed acid-fast bacilli. This late finding led to the conclusion that the Sweet's syndrome was likely a reaction to an underlying, undiagnosed M. tuberculosis infection.
